III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Eligibility requirements
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12504
Section • (3) An independent living home, staffed and operated by
Description the child placing agency, must be clean, safe, and
appropriate to the needs of the youth it serves.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The home has been infested with bed bugs on an on-going basis.
Youth A had bed bugs in her room and the agency was not helpful
in eliminating the infestation
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Independent Living Worker by telephone on
5/2/2024. Independent Living Worker stated Youth A reported the
concern on 5/1/24 to the Independent Living Worker on their way
to school. The Independent Living Worker advised Youth A should
wash all items in hot water, vacuum, and to contain the items. The
Independent Living Worker told Youth A the Independent Living
Worker will let Life Skills Coach and House Manager know so she
can purchase youth a new mattress cover and bed bug spray. Life
Skills Coach purchased items right away and met with Youth A on
5/1/24 in the evening. Life Skills Coach texted caseworker on
5/2/24 detailing her efforts. Life Skills Coach and youth flipped
mattress, inspected baseboards, and carpet. They found one live
bed bug and one dead. They sprayed the areas twice and
vacuumed. Youth A was provided new cover and was told to wash
items weekly and to vacuum. Life Skills Coach advised Youth A to
not eat in their room as they found food crumbs on floor. Youth A
stated she didn't eat in room. No other youth have reported bed
bugs. Caseworker told upper management of issue on 5/1/24
during a meeting. A pest inspector can come to ILP house if need
be.
I interviewed House Manager at the independent living placement
on 5/23/2024. House Manager substantiated the report by
Independent Living Worker. House Manager also stated the
agency had previously contracted with a pest control company to
inspect the home monthly, but that was discontinued when no
pest infestation treatments were ever required. I requested any
documentation related to the most recent pest control inspections.
I interviewed Youth B in Youth B’s room on 5/23/2024. Youth B
denied having any bed bugs in Youth B’s room.
2

I interviewed Youth C on 5/23//2024. Youth C denied having any
bed bugs in Youth C’s room.
I interviewed Youth A by telephone on 6/3/2024 and Youth A
confirmed the issue had been resolved.
Tour Observation:
A walk through of the laundry area, kitchen, and common areas of
the home indicated the home was clean, safe, and appropriate for
occupancy. I inspected the room of Youth A and there were no
signs of bed bugs.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the pest control inspection reports for January,
February, and March 2024. The January report identified 2
spiders, the February report identified 2 moths, and no pests were
identified in the March inspection report.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as the home was clean based
on staff and youth interviews, pest control inspection reports, and
a physical walk through/onsite inspection of the home by this
consultant.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
